data_table.description: Leptin Receptor, NOS and Generation 3 Cohorts Exam 1. Please see flag variable in order to use the correct subset of data.

variable.name: shareid
variable.description: Framingham Heart Study participant SHARe ID number

variable.name: plate
variable.description: ELISA Plate ID that sample was run on
variable.comment: PLATE variable indicates date the plate was run as well as the initials of the Tech who ran it. If there were more than 1 plate run on a specific day by the same Tech, it is delineated by an A or B.

variable.name: res1
variable.description: Leptin Receptor Result for first well(sample type: serum)
variable.value: Unknown or only run in singleton

variable.name: res2
variable.description: Leptin Receptor Result for second well(sample type: serum)
variable.value: Unknown or only run in singleton

variable.name: cvper
variable.description: Percent CV for those run in duplicate
variable.value: Unknown or only run in singleton

variable.name: leptinr
variable.comment: For flag = 1, 2 or 3, LEPTINR is the same as RES1 regardless of whether the sample was done in duplicate or not. For flag = 4, LEPTINR is the mean of RES1 and RES2 because all controls were done in duplicate. LEPTINR means for the individual flags are as follows:1.61 - 76.65 for flag = 16.26 - 44.25 for flag = 26.09 - 47.31 for flag = 33.35 - 23.89 for flag = 4.

variable.name: flag
variable.comment: When doing analysis, use flag = 1 and 2. Phantoms have their FHS ID number listed under IDTYPE and ID, with their phantom id number listed under PHANTOM_ID. When looking at phantom samples, use flag = 3 records as well as their corresponding FHS ID numbers in either flag = 1 or 2.
variable.value: FHS samples that can be used for analysis, done in singleton
FHS samples that can be used for analysis, done in duplicate

variable.name: phantom_id
variable.comment: Phantoms have their FHS ID number listed under IDTYPE and ID, with their phantom id number listed under PHANTOM_ID.
